verbose_text: According to the ROC analysis (AUC = 0.894, 95% CI : 0.779 to 1.000, p < 0.001, XREF_FIG), a pre reperfusion potassium level of 4.45 mmol/L was a good predictor of reperfusion hyperkalemia (potassium level over 5.50 mmol/L) with a sensitivity of 69.23% (95% CI : 38.57% -90.91%) and a specificity of 94.12% (95% CI : 71.31% -99.85%, positive likelihood ratio = 11.77).
